name: UiPathRunJob
description: Runs a UiPath process onto UiPath Orchestrator.
author: UiPath

inputs.name: orchestratorConnection
inputs.label: Orchestrator connection
inputs.helpMarkDown: A service connection to the Orchestrator instance on which we will run the jobs.

inputs.name: processName
inputs.label: Process
inputs.helpMarkDown: Process name. You can take the process name from the Orchestrator UI. If the process is deployed in a Modern Folder then this argument should be the `NAME` of the process in the Processes tab. If the process is deployed in a Classic Folder, then the argument must be formed by the `NAME` of the process and the `ENVIRONMENT` (eg: NAME: `ProcessA` ENVIRONMENT: `Production` ProcessName: `ProcessA_Production`).

inputs.name: parametersFilePath
inputs.label: Input parameters
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specify the full path to a json input file, e.g. Input\jobParameters.json.

inputs.name: folderName
inputs.label: Orchestrator folder
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specify the folder to deploy to. For clasic folders, you can use specific robot names. For modern folders, you can use specific user and machine names.

inputs.name: strategy
inputs.label: Strategy
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specify the job run strategy, dynamically allocated job(s) or robot specific job(s).

inputs.name: user
inputs.label: User
inputs.helpMarkDown: The name of the user. This feature is available only on modern folders! This should be a machine user, not an orchestrator user. For local users, the format should be MachineName\UserName

inputs.name: machine
inputs.label: Machine
inputs.helpMarkDown: The name of the machine. This feature is available only on modern folders!

inputs.name: robotsIds
inputs.label: Robot names
inputs.helpMarkDown: Comma-separated list of specific robot names.

inputs.name: resultFilePath
inputs.label: Output
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specify the output full path of the job results, e.g. Output\testResults.json. The results are output in json format. If not specified, the results are output to the artifact staging directory as UiPathResults.json. The output is in json format.

inputs.name: timeout
inputs.label: Timeout (seconds)
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specify the job run(s) timeout in seconds.

inputs.name: failWhenJobFails
inputs.label: Fail task when job fails
inputs.helpMarkDown: The task fails when at least one job fails. (default true)

inputs.name: waitForJobCompletion
inputs.label: Wait for job completion
inputs.helpMarkDown: Wait for job run(s) completion. (default true)
